hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $7{,}920$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $79{,}200$.

Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
$\searrow\goldD7$ | $\searrow\purpleD9$ | $\searrow\blueC2$ | $\searrow\greenD0$ |$\cancel0$
 | $\goldD7$ | $\purpleD9$ | $\blueC2$ | $\greenD0$


Moving each digit of $79{,}200$ to the right means dividing by $10$:

$\goldD7\purpleD9{,}\blueD2\greenD00 \div 10 
= \goldD7{,}\purpleD9\blueD2\greenD0$

question.content:
**Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**
  

$79{,}200$ [[☃ dropdown 1]] $10=7{,}920$
